alert.note: Alert for Cimarron (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of the Panhandle of Oklahoma, including the following county, Cimarron. * WHEN...Until 315 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1115 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boise City, Black Mesa Park, Wheeless and Kenton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
